result.execSummary:
The defendant Zenon Cruz Gregorio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If not paid in full timely, defendant may be found in contempt of Court, ordered to spend up to 11 days county jail with huber privileges and the remaining unpaid obligations docketed & enforced as a civil judgment against you. The Defendant shall keep the Clerk of Court's office advised of any change of address until the fine is paid in full.

If defendant has not already done so, he/she shall provide a biological specimen to the State Crime Laboratory for deoxyribonucleic acid analysis (DNA testing) pursuant to Section 973.047(1f) Wis. Stats.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
